thread.title_full: Stray lioness causes panic among motorists along Southern bypass - Nairobi News

title: Stray lioness causes panic among motorists along Southern bypass - Nairobi News
text:
Stray lioness causes panic among motorists along Southern bypass Posted on Feb 21, 2017 5131 Views A photo of the stray lioness that was spotted along the Southern Bypass. PHOTO | COURTESY By SYLVANIA AMBANI 
There was panic among motorists using the Southern Bypass on Monday night following the spotting of a stray lioness along the highway. 
Photos taken by motorists show the lioness roaming next to a fence. The photos have been shared widely on social media eliciting panic from netizens. A photo of the stray lioness that was spotted along the Southern Bypass. PHOTO | COURTESY 
But in a quick response the Kenya Wildlife Service through its Twitter handle assured Kenyans that the lioness has been driven back into the park. We are glad to confirm that #lioness that had strayed from Nairobi Park has since been driven back. All collared lions can be accounted for pic.twitter.com/rGe1ZGrrIM 
Last year a group of six lions wandered out of the Nairobi National Park and were spotted roaming free in Langat estate. Latest Stories
